repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: Schoolwork and scrapbooks from Lillian Coons's time at the State College for Teachers (1935-1939) where she was a member of Phi Delta and studied English, Social Studies, and Library Science.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: Contains five scrapbooks, along with photos, schoolwork, and ephemera from the State College for Teachers between the years 1935-1941. Contents include letters, personal notes, postcards, newspaper clippings, graded exams, poems, programs, pamphlets, class schedules, and drawings.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Lillian Coons was born Lillian Elizabeth Hines in 1918 in Poland, NY. She attended the State College for Teachers from 1935-1940 where she was a member of Phi Delta. She completed a BA in English and Social Studies and a BS in Library Science. She married Earl Coons of Delanson, NY in 1941. She worked as a librarian in Ilion High School in Ilion, NY (1940-1942), then as a Typist in Camp Stewart, GA (1943) before returnng to Ilion Elementary School (1961-1962) and as a Librarian in Poland Central School (1962-1967) and Ilion High School (1967-1982). She died of colon cancer in 1991.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Maintained the order of the collection, unless Preservation would like to do something else to the scrapbooks.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: First described in 2019 by Gregory Wiedeman.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: All items in this collection were donated to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives by Lillian Coon's son William Coons in 2019.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This page may contain links to digital objects. Access to these images and the technical capacity to download them does not imply permission for re-use. Digital objects may be used freely for personal reference use, referred to, or linked to from other web sites.
Researchers do not have permission to publish or disseminate material from these collections without permission from an archivist and/or the copyright holder.

The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming to the laws of copyright. Some materials in these collections may be protected by the U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) and/or by the copyright or neighboring-rights laws of other nations. More information about U.S. Copyright is provided by the Copyright Office. The M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collection and Archives is eager to hear from any copyright owners who are not properly identified so that appropriate information may be provided in the future.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Lillian Coons Papers, 1935-2019. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Coons Papers).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: First volume scrapbook from the Lillain Coons collection. Created by Lillain during her Freshman year, containing schoolwork, pamphlets, programs, letters, personal notes, and newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Second volume scrapbook from the Lillain Coons collection. Created by Lillain during her Sophomore year, containing schoolwork, pamphlets, programs, letters, personal notes, and newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Third volume scrapbook from the Lillain Coons collection. Created by Lillain during her Junior year, containing schoolwork, pamphlets, programs, letters, personal notes, postcards, a felted sign, and newspaper clippings.
